definition: tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Here's a video to flesh out any curiosities you may have about the blackening of the bride.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个视频可以把你对把新娘弄黑的好奇具体化。

sentences.english: You might also choose to externalize the routing using an endpoint lookup primitive.
sentences.chinese: 您还可能通过一个端点查找原语来具体化路由。

sentences.english: The design of layout plan drawing is the carrying out and realizing of initial design.
sentences.chinese: 平面布置图是初步设计的具体化和明确化。

sentences.english: As with all mere abstractions, we must not reify space.
sentences.chinese: 如同所有的只是抽象的，我们决不能具体化的空间。

sentences.english: Sub-aspects that extend these must concretize the pointcuts.
sentences.chinese: 扩展抽象方面的子方面必须具体化切入点。

sentences.english: But the trouble with rounded personalities is that they don't tessellate.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们没有把这“丰富的个性”具体化。

sentences.english: Being specific means setting a concrete goal, one you can measure.
sentences.chinese: 具体化就是设定明确的目标，一个你可以衡量的目标。

sentences.english: Inhibition-of-reified-processes predicted accuracy through arithmetic intrusions.
sentences.chinese: 过程具体化类型的抑制预示算术侵入与准确度有关。

sentences.english: He materialized his ideas by building a model.
sentences.chinese: 他制作了一个模型使自己的想法具体化了。

sentences.english: The load itself will be materialized in a file system directory.
sentences.chinese: 加载本身将在文件系统目录中具体化。

sentences.english: Journalists' right to interview derives from freedom of speech and embodies the right to know.
sentences.chinese: 采访权来源于言论自由，是知情权的具体化。

sentences.english: An application lock could not be acquired for materializing views.
sentences.chinese: 无法为具体化视图获取应用程序锁。

sentences.english: Jean-Paul Sartre's dramas are the illustration and concretization of his philosophical thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 萨特的戏剧是他哲学思想的图解和具体化。

sentences.english: Metaphor is one kind of means to make the abstract idea concretize in vocabulary teaching.
sentences.chinese: 隐喻是词汇教学中使抽象概念具体化的一种手段。

sentences.english: Software is intangible. It is the embodiment of an idea.
sentences.chinese: 软件是无形资产，他是思想的具体化。

sentences.english: However, Ingarden does regard some concretizations as preferable to others;
sentences.chinese: 然而，英伽登的确认为某些具体化要比其他的更可取。

definition: to give a more granular level of detail/to elaborate/to refine/to become more differentiated
to sum up/to summarize/to conclude from facts/induction (method of deduction in logic)
to come to the surface/to become apparent
